Ingredients.name: Australian Amber Malt
Ingredients.description:
Amber malt is a roasted malt that is used in mild ales, brown ales and some bitters, it is exceptionally good when used in porters. It has a Dry Mild Coffee 
flavour.

Ingredients.name: Australian Caramalt
Ingredients.description: Caramalt is produced in much the same way as Crystal. It is used wheresweetness is less important but some colour enhancement and a 'dry' flavour is required.

Ingredients.name: Australian Chocolate Malt
Ingredients.description: Chocolate Malt used in small quantities adds a rich chocolatey flavour to porters, milds and some bitters.

Ingredients.name: Australian Crystal 140
Ingredients.description: Crystal Malt has a distinct nutty taste and is used to add flavour and body to hoppy British beers. Like ‘standard’ Crystal, Pale & Dark are used to enhance body, colour and flavour of ales and lagers but Dark Crystal with its strong reddish brown colour is usually used for darker beers such as Milds & dark Bitters & Pale Crystal is usually used for Lagers and pale Bitters.

Ingredients.name: Australian Dark Crystal
Ingredients.description: Crystal/Caramel malt has a distinct nutty taste and is used to add flavour and body to beers. Darker crystal malts with their strong reddish brown colour is usually used for darker beers such as milds & dark bitters. Lighter crystal malts are usually used for lagers and ales.

Ingredients.name: Australian Dark Munich
Ingredients.description: Munich malt is a base malt that provides a malty, grainy flavor. Whilst it can self-convert, it has lower enzyme levels than pale or pilsner malts.

Ingredients.name: Australian Export Pilsner Malt
Ingredients.description: Pilsner Malt is kilned at fairly low temperature. It's flavor is usually described as slighty nutty and biscuity.

Ingredients.name: Australian Light Munich
Ingredients.description: Munich malt is a base malt that provides a malty, grainy flavor. Whilst it can self-convert, it has lower enzyme levels than pale or pilsner malts.

Ingredients.name: Australian Roast Barley
Ingredients.description: Used sparingly, this roasted grain imparts a sweet, coffee-like, grainy flavor and red to deep brown color. Typically used in Irish stouts.

Ingredients.name: Australian Roasted Wheat
Ingredients.description: Intensifies the typical aroma and color of dark top fermented beers such as Altbier, Weizen, and Weizenbock.

Ingredients.name: Australian Traditional Ale Malt
Ingredients.description: Pale malt is the basic ingredient of many beers - especially ales. It is kilned at a low temperature over a long period and has good diastatic activity.

Ingredients.name: Australian Wheat Malt
Ingredients.description: Essential in making wheat beers, wheat is also often used in lower amounts in other beers as its protein gives the beer a fuller mouthfeel and enhanced beer head stability. Wheat malt contains considerably more protein than barley malt and consists primarily of glutens that can result in beer haze.

Ingredients.name: Belgian Aromatic Malt
Ingredients.description: Used at rates of up to 10%, Aromatic malt will lend a distinct, almost exaggerated malt aroma and flavor to the finished Ales and Lagers. Aromatic malt also has a rich color and is high in diastatic power for aid in starch conversion.

Ingredients.name: Belgian Biscuit Malt
Ingredients.description: Biscuit is a lightly roasted malt. Used at the rate of 3 to 15 %, it adds a toasted flavor and aroma characteristic to lagers and ales.

Ingredients.name: Belgian Cara 20 Malt
Ingredients.description: A light crystal malt used by Belgian breweries in producing Abbey or Trappist style ales and is appropriate for any recipe that calls for crystal malt.

Ingredients.name: Belgian Cara 45 Malt
Ingredients.description: A medium-amber crystal malt that will impart a rich, caramel-sweet aroma and full flavor, as well as intense color.

Ingredients.name: Belgian Cara 8 Malt
Ingredients.description: A very light crystal malt made by drying barley malt at low temperatures. The result is a malt that will lend body, smoother mouth-feel, and foam stability.

Ingredients.name: Belgian CaraPilsner Malt
Ingredients.description: A very light colored crystal malt that is also sometimes known as dextrin malt. It adds to foam stability, body, and palate fullness. It also significantly enhances head retention.

Ingredients.name: Belgian Caramel Amber Malt
Ingredients.description: Intensifies the aroma and color of dark beers.

Ingredients.name: Belgian Caramel Munich Malt 120
Ingredients.description: For increased fullness, heightened malt aroma, full, round flavor, deep, saturated color.

Ingredients.name: Belgian Caramel Munich Malt 40
Ingredients.description: For increased fullness, heightened malt aroma, full, round flavor, deep, saturated color.

Ingredients.name: Belgian Caramel Munich Malt 60
Ingredients.description: For increased fullness, heightened malt aroma, full, round flavor, deep, saturated color.

Ingredients.name: Belgian Caramel Munich Malt 80
Ingredients.description: For increased fullness, heightened malt aroma, full, round flavor, deep, saturated color.

Ingredients.name: Belgian Caramel Vienna Malt
Ingredients.description: A light crystal malt used by Belgian breweries in producing Abbey or Trappist style ales and is appropriate for any recipe that calls for crystal malt.

Ingredients.name: Belgian Caramel Wheat Malt
Ingredients.description: Promotes fullness, emphasized typical wheat malt aroma & enhanced color.

Ingredients.name: Belgian Chocolate Malt
Ingredients.description: Chocolate Malt used in small quantities adds a rich chocolatey flavour to porters, milds and some bitters.

Ingredients.name: Belgian Dark Munich Malt
Ingredients.description: Munich malt is a base malt that provides a malty, grainy flavor. Whilst it can self-convert, it has lower enzyme levels than pale or pilsner malts.

Ingredients.name: Belgian Dark Wheat Malt
Ingredients.description: Dark Wheat Malt is not particularly dark in colour but richer in flavour than the standard Wheat malt.

Ingredients.name: Belgian Debittered Black Malt
Ingredients.description: Contributes the same color characteristics as Black malt with a less astringent flavor.

Ingredients.name: Belgian Kiln Amber Malt
Ingredients.description:
Amber malt is a roasted malt that is used in mild ales, brown ales and some bitters, it is exceptionally good when used in porters. It has a Dry Mild Coffee 
flavour.

Ingredients.name: Belgian Kiln Black
Ingredients.description: Gives a sharp flavor and black color. This malt adds a lot of color and should be used in moderation.

Ingredients.name: Belgian Kiln Coffee Malt
Ingredients.description: This unique malt imparts a pleasant coffee flavor. Use it in stouts, porters, brown ales, and Scottish ales.

Ingredients.name: Belgian Munich Malt
Ingredients.description: Munich malt is a base malt that provides a malty, grainy flavor. Whilst it can self-convert, it has lower enzyme levels than pale or pilsner malts.

Ingredients.name: Belgian Pale Malt
Ingredients.description: Pale malt is the basic ingredient of many beers - especially ales. It is kilned at a low temperature over a long period and has good diastatic activity.

Ingredients.name: Belgian Pale Wheat Malt
Ingredients.description: Essential in making wheat beers, wheat is also often used in lower amounts in other beers as its protein gives the beer a fuller mouthfeel and enhanced beer head stability. Wheat malt contains considerably more protein than barley malt and consists primarily of glutens that can result in beer haze.

Ingredients.name: Belgian Pilsen Malt
Ingredients.description: Pilsner Malt is kilned at fairly low temperature. It's flavor is usually described as slighty nutty and biscuity.

Ingredients.name: Belgian Roast Wheat Malt
Ingredients.description: Intensifies the typical aroma and color of dark top fermented beers such as Altbier, Weizen, and Weizenbock.

Ingredients.name: Belgian Special B
Ingredients.description: The darkest of the Belgian crystal malts, Special B will impart a heavy caramel taste and is often credited with the raisin-like flavors of some Belgian Abbey ales. Larger percentages (greater than 5%) will contribute a dark brown-black color and fuller body.

Ingredients.name: Belgian Vienna Malt
Ingredients.description: Vienna is a rich, aromatic malt that will lend a deep color and full flavor to Vienna or Märzen style beers.

Ingredients.name: Canadian Honey Malt (Gambrinus)
Ingredients.description: Honey malt is Gambrinus Malting's best description for the unique European malt known as brumalt. Its intense malt sweetness makes it perfect for any specialty beer. It is devoid of any astringent roast flavors.

Ingredients.name: German Bohemian Pilsner Malt
Ingredients.description: Pilsner Malt is kilned at fairly low temperature. It's flavor is usually described as slighty nutty and biscuity.

Ingredients.name: German Brumalt
Ingredients.description: Honey malt is Gambrinus Malting's best description for the unique European malt known as brumalt. Its intense malt sweetness makes it perfect for any specialty beer. It is devoid of any astringent roast flavors.

Ingredients.name: German CaraAmber
Ingredients.description: Intensifies the aroma and color of dark beers.

Ingredients.name: German CaraAroma
Ingredients.description: Imparts fuller body and improved malt aroma to dark beers.

Ingredients.name: German CaraMunich I
Ingredients.description: For increased fullness, heightened malt aroma, full, round flavor, deep, saturated color.

Ingredients.name: German CaraMunich II
Ingredients.description: For increased fullness, heightened malt aroma, full, round flavor, deep, saturated color.

Ingredients.name: German CaraMunich III
Ingredients.description: For increased fullness, heightened malt aroma, full, round flavor, deep, saturated color.

Ingredients.name: German CaraRed
Ingredients.description: Gives fuller body, improved malt aroma and a deep saturated red color to beers.

Ingredients.name: German Carafa I
Ingredients.description: Carafa smoothly intensifies the aroma and color of dark beers.

Ingredients.name: German Carafa II
Ingredients.description: Carafa smoothly intensifies the aroma and color of dark beers.

Ingredients.name: German Carafa III
Ingredients.description: Carafa smoothly intensifies the aroma and color of dark beers.

Ingredients.name: German Carafa Special I
Ingredients.description: A dehusked version of the corresponding Carafa I

Ingredients.name: German Carafa Special II
Ingredients.description: A dehusked version of the corresponding Carafa II

Ingredients.name: German Carafa Special III
Ingredients.description: A dehusked version of the corresponding Carafa III

Ingredients.name: German Carahell
Ingredients.description: Kilned slightly darker than carapil, carahell imparts a fuller, rounder flavor and deep color to pale ale, Oktoberfest, Maibock, and hefeweizen.

Ingredients.name: German Caramel Malt Dark
Ingredients.description: Crystal/Caramel Malt has a distinct nutty taste and is used to add flavour and body to hoppy British beers. Like ‘standard’ Crystal, Pale & Dark are used to enhance body, colour and flavour of ales and lagers but Dark Crystal with its strong reddish brown colour is usually used for darker beers such as Milds & dark Bitters & Pale Crystal is usually used for Lagers and pale Bitters.

Ingredients.name: German Caramel Malt Light
Ingredients.description: Crystal/Caramel Malt has a distinct nutty taste and is used to add flavour and body to hoppy British beers. Like ‘standard’ Crystal, Pale & Dark are used to enhance body, colour and flavour of ales and lagers but Dark Crystal with its strong reddish brown colour is usually used for darker beers such as Milds & dark Bitters & Pale Crystal is usually used for Lagers and pale Bitters.

Ingredients.name: German Caramel Pils
Ingredients.description: A very light colored crystal malt that is also sometimes known as dextrin malt. It adds to foam stability, body, and palate fullness. It also significantly enhances head retention.

Ingredients.name: German Caramel Wheat Malt
Ingredients.description: Promotes fullness, emphasized typical wheat malt aroma & enhanced color.

Ingredients.name: German Chocolate Rye Malt
Ingredients.description: Malted rye that has been steeped and roasted to a very dark color. Adds deep color and roasted character.

Ingredients.name: German Chocolate Wheat Malt
Ingredients.description: Malted wheat that has been steeped and roasted to create a very dark color. Adds deep color and roasted character.

Ingredients.name: German Dark Munich Malt
Ingredients.description: Munich malt is a base malt that provides a malty, grainy flavor. Whilst it can self-convert, it has lower enzyme levels than pale or pilsner malts.

Ingredients.name: German Dark Wheat Malt
Ingredients.description: Dark Wheat Malt is not particularly dark in colour but richer in flavour than the standard Wheat malt.

Ingredients.name: German Farb Malt
Ingredients.description: Roasted at high temperatures to produce a strong, nearly black malt, Farb Malt is used to add color and smoky / burnt flavors to dark beers, such as stouts and porters.

Ingredients.name: German Melanoidin Malt
Ingredients.description: Melanoidin Malts give beer a reddish tint, improved fullness and roundness of flavour and enhanced flavour stability.

Ingredients.name: German Munich Malt
Ingredients.description: Munich malt is a base malt that provides a malty, grainy flavor. Whilst it can self-convert, it has lower enzyme levels than pale or pilsner malts.

Ingredients.name: German Pale Ale Malt
Ingredients.description: Pale malt is the basic ingredient of many beers - especially ales. It is kilned at a low temperature over a long period and has good diastatic activity.

Ingredients.name: German Pilsner Malt
Ingredients.description: Pilsner Malt is kilned at fairly low temperature. It's flavor is usually described as slighty nutty and biscuity.

Ingredients.name: German Roasted Barley
Ingredients.description: Used sparingly, this roasted grain imparts a sweet, coffee-like, grainy flavor and red to deep brown color. Typically used in Irish stouts.

Ingredients.name: German Roasted Rye
Ingredients.description: Intensifies the color and typical aroma of dark, top-fermented beers.

Ingredients.name: German Rost Malt
Ingredients.description: This dark, aromatic malt is used for coloring and improving body and malt aroma of dark beers.

Ingredients.name: German Rye Malt
Ingredients.description: Rye kilned to produce a typical smoked aroma. The malt is primarily used to create rye beers, smoked beers, Lagerbiers, and Kellerbiers

Ingredients.name: German Sauer(Acid) Malt
Ingredients.description: Produced with natural lactic acid bacteria, Sauer malt may be used to adjust mash pH. Especially useful in pale lagers.

Ingredients.name: German Sinamar (Weyermann)
Ingredients.description: An intensely  dark malt extract tha may be used to adjust beer color.

Ingredients.name: German Smoked Malt
Ingredients.description: Smoked over beechwood, this malt adds a distinctive smoked flavor and aroma.

Ingredients.name: German Vienna Malt
Ingredients.description: Vienna is a rich, aromatic malt that will lend a deep color and full flavor to Vienna or Märzen style beers.

Ingredients.name: German Wheat Malt
Ingredients.description: Essential in making wheat beers, wheat is also often used in lower amounts in other beers as its protein gives the beer a fuller mouthfeel and enhanced beer head stability. Wheat malt contains considerably more protein than barley malt and consists primarily of glutens that can result in beer haze.

Ingredients.name: Sugar - Candi Sugar Amber
Ingredients.description: Amber crystallized sucrose.

Ingredients.name: Sugar - Candi Sugar Dark
Ingredients.description: Dark crystallized sucrose.

Ingredients.name: Sugar - Candi Sugar Pale
Ingredients.description: Pale crystalized sucrose.

Ingredients.name: Sugar - Dark Candi Syrup
Ingredients.description: A dark, liquid sugar syrup suitable for use in Belgian-style ales.

Ingredients.name: Sugar - Demerara
Ingredients.description: A less refined grade of sucrose.

Ingredients.name: Sugar - Invert Sugar (Golden) Syrup
Ingredients.description: Sucrose that has been 'inverted' into it's two constituent monosaccharides. Often used in British brewing.

Ingredients.name: Sugar - Lactose
Ingredients.description: 'Milk' sugar, this sugar is not fermentable by yeasts and so leaves a sweet beer. It's is most widely used in sweet stouts.

Ingredients.name: Sugar - Molasses
Ingredients.description: A very dark syrup that is a byporduct of sugar refining. Has a very strong flavor.

Ingredients.name: Sugar - Muscovado
Ingredients.description: A dark, less-refined version of sucrose.

Ingredients.name: Sugar - Turbinado
Ingredients.description: A less refined version of sucrose.

Ingredients.name: Sugar - White Sugar/Sucrose
Ingredients.description: Pure white table sugar.

Ingredients.name: UK Amber Malt
Ingredients.description:
Amber malt is a roasted malt that is used in mild ales, brown ales and some bitters, it is exceptionally good when used in porters. It has a Dry Mild Coffee 
flavour.

Ingredients.name: UK Black Malt
Ingredients.description: Gives a sharp flavor and black color. This malt adds a lot of color and should be used in moderation.

Ingredients.name: UK Brown Malt
Ingredients.description: Imparts a dry mild coffee flavor and bitterness to beer. Works great in older styles of English ales such as brown ales and mild stouts and porters.

Ingredients.name: UK Caramalt
Ingredients.description: Caramalt is produced in much the same way as Crystal. It is used where sweetness is less important but some colour enhancement and a 'dry' flavour is required.

Ingredients.name: UK Carastan Malt
Ingredients.description: A pale, brown-colored crystal malt with a caramel/toffee-like flavor.

Ingredients.name: UK Chocolate Malt
Ingredients.description: Chocolate Malt used in small quantities adds a rich chocolatey flavour to porters, milds and some bitters.

Ingredients.name: UK Crystal Rye Malt
Ingredients.description: Displays warm wholemeal biscuit flavors allied to characteristic rye spiciness.

Ingredients.name: UK Crystal Wheat Malt
Ingredients.description: Promotes fullness, emphasized typical wheat malt aroma & enhanced color.

Ingredients.name: UK Dark Crystal
Ingredients.description: Crystal/Caramel Malt has a distinct nutty taste and is used to add flavour and body to hoppy British beers. Like ‘standard’ Crystal, Pale & Dark are used to enhance body, colour and flavour of ales and lagers but Dark Crystal with its strong reddish brown colour is usually used for darker beers such as Milds & dark Bitters & Pale Crystal is usually used for Lagers and pale Bitters.

Ingredients.name: UK Extra Dark Crystal
Ingredients.description: Crystal/Caramel Malt has a distinct nutty taste and is used to add flavour and body to hoppy British beers. Like ‘standard’ Crystal, Pale & Dark are used to enhance body, colour and flavour of ales and lagers but Dark Crystal with its strong reddish brown colour is usually used for darker beers such as Milds & dark Bitters & Pale Crystal is usually used for Lagers and pale Bitters.

Ingredients.name: UK Flaked Barley
Ingredients.description: Flaked unmalted barley is often used in Stouts to provide protein for head retention and body.

Ingredients.name: UK Flaked Corn/Maize
Ingredients.description: Corn will lighten the color and body of the beer without overpowering the flavor. A common adjunct in British ales.

Ingredients.name: UK Flaked Oats
Ingredients.description: Imparts the dry grainy flavor characteristic of oatmeal stout.

Ingredients.name: UK Flaked Rice
Ingredients.description: Provides a light, crisp finish to your beer

Ingredients.name: UK Lager Malt
Ingredients.description: The British version of Pilsner malt, it is kilned at fairly low temperature. It's flavor is usually described as slighty nutty and biscuity.

Ingredients.name: UK Light Carastan Malt
Ingredients.description: Final roasting is prolonged at a lower temperature to achieve a low target color than normal Carastan.

Ingredients.name: UK Light Crystal
Ingredients.description: Crystal/Caramel Malt has a distinct nutty taste and is used to add flavour and body to hoppy British beers. Like ‘standard’ Crystal, Pale & Dark are used to enhance body, colour and flavour of ales and lagers but Dark Crystal with its strong reddish brown colour is usually used for darker beers such as Milds & dark Bitters & Pale Crystal is usually used for Lagers and pale Bitters.

Ingredients.name: UK Medium Crystal
Ingredients.description: Crystal/Caramel Malt has a distinct nutty taste and is used to add flavour and body to hoppy British beers. Like ‘standard’ Crystal, Pale & Dark are used to enhance body, colour and flavour of ales and lagers but Dark Crystal with its strong reddish brown colour is usually used for darker beers such as Milds & dark Bitters & Pale Crystal is usually used for Lagers and pale Bitters.

Ingredients.name: UK Mild Ale Malt
Ingredients.description: Produces a wort with higher dextrin content than pale malts, resulting in a sweeter beer.

Ingredients.name: UK Munich Malt
Ingredients.description: Munich malt is a base malt that provides a malty, grainy flavor. Whilst it can self-convert, it has lower enzyme levels than pale or pilsner malts.

Ingredients.name: UK Oat Malt
Ingredients.description: Adding oat malt to your mash is the best way to brew authentic oatmeal stout, and malted oats impart a unique silky, almost oily mouthfeel.

Ingredients.name: UK Pale Ale Malt
Ingredients.description: Pale malt is the basic ingredient of many beers - especially ales. It is kilned at a low temperature over a long period and has good diastatic activity.

Ingredients.name: UK Pale Ale Malt (Low color)
Ingredients.description: Pale malt is the basic ingredient of many beers - especially ales. It is kilned at a low temperature over a long period and has good diastatic activity.

Ingredients.name: UK Pale Chocolate Malt
Ingredients.description: Chocolate Malt used in small quantities adds a rich chocolatey flavour to porters, milds and some bitters.

Ingredients.name: UK Peated Malt
Ingredients.description: Employed in Scotch Ales to add a smoky flavor. This is an easy malt to over use.

Ingredients.name: UK Roasted Barley
Ingredients.description: Used sparingly, this roasted grain imparts a sweet, coffee-like, grainy flavor and red to deep brown color. Typically used in Irish stouts.

Ingredients.name: UK Roasted Wheat Malt
Ingredients.description: Intensifies the typical aroma and color of dark top fermented beers such as Altbier, Weizen, and Weizenbock.

Ingredients.name: UK Rye Malt
Ingredients.description: Rye kilned to produce a typical smoked aroma. The malt is primarily used to create rye beers, smoked beers, Lagerbiers, and Kellerbiers

Ingredients.name: UK Torrified Maize
Ingredients.description: Popcorn

Ingredients.name: UK Torrified Wheat
Ingredients.description: This whole kernel version of flaked wheat will improve body and head retention.

Ingredients.name: UK Vienna Malt
Ingredients.description: Vienna is a rich, aromatic malt that will lend a deep color and full flavor to Vienna or Märzen style beers.

Ingredients.name: UK Wheat Malt
Ingredients.description: Essential in making wheat beers, wheat is also often used in lower amounts in other beers as its protein gives the beer a fuller mouthfeel and enhanced beer head stability. Wheat malt contains considerably more protein than barley malt and consists primarily of glutens that can result in beer haze.

Ingredients.name: US Aromatic Malt
Ingredients.description: Used at rates of up to 10%, Aromatic malt will lend a distinct, almost exaggerated malt aroma and flavor to the finished Ales and Lagers. Aromatic malt also has a rich color and is high in diastatic power for aid in starch conversion.

Ingredients.name: US Black Barley
Ingredients.description: Used in Irish stouts, gives a more pronounced dryness than roasted barley.

Ingredients.name: US Black Malt
Ingredients.description: Gives a sharp flavor and black color. This malt adds a lot of color and should be used in moderation.

Ingredients.name: US Bonlander Munich Malt
Ingredients.description: Munich malt is a base malt that provides a malty, grainy flavor. Whilst it can self-convert, it has lower enzyme levels than pale or pilsner malts.

Ingredients.description: Crystal/Caramel malt has a distinct nutty taste and is used to add flavour and body to beers. Darker crystal malts with their strong reddish brown colour is usually used for darker beers such as milds & dark bitters. Lighter crystal malts are usually used for lagers and ales.

Darker crystal malts with their strong reddish brown colour is usually used for darker beers such as milds & dark bitters. Lighter crystal malts are usually used for lagers and ales.

Ingredients.name: US Caramel Munich 60L Malt
Ingredients.description: For increased fullness, heightened malt aroma, full, round flavor, deep, saturated color.

Ingredients.name: US Caramel Vienne 20L Malt
Ingredients.description: A light crystal malt used by Belgian breweries in producing Abbey or Trappist style ales and is appropriate for any recipe that calls for crystal malt.

Ingredients.name: US Carapils Malt
Ingredients.description: A very light colored crystal malt that is also sometimes known as dextrin malt. It adds to foam stability, body, and palate fullness. It also significantly enhances head retention.

Ingredients.name: US Chocolate Malt
Ingredients.description: Chocolate Malt used in small quantities adds a rich chocolatey flavour to porters, milds and some bitters.

Ingredients.name: US Dark Chocolate Malt
Ingredients.description: Chocolate Malt used in small quantities adds a rich chocolatey flavour to porters, milds and some bitters.

Ingredients.name: US Extra Special Malt
Ingredients.description: This is a unique malt that is used in many types of beer to acheive the profound raisiny flavor notes often associated with darker high gravity beers such as dopplebock

Ingredients.name: US Flaked Barley
Ingredients.description: Flaked unmalted barley is often used in Stouts to provide protein for head retention and body.

Ingredients.name: US Flaked Corn/Maize
Ingredients.description: Corn will lighten the color and body of the beer without overpowering the flavor. A common adjunct in British ales.

Ingredients.name: US Flaked Oats
Ingredients.description: Imparts the dry grainy flavor characteristic of oatmeal stout.

Ingredients.name: US Flaked Rice
Ingredients.description: Provides a light, crisp finish to your beer

Ingredients.name: US Flaked Rye
Ingredients.description: Flaked unmalted rye used for making German-style rye beers and other rye-based beers

Ingredients.name: US Flaked Soft Red Wheat
Ingredients.description: Unmalted wheat is a common ingredient in wheat beers. Adds starch haze and high levels of protein. Flaked wheat adds more wheat flavor "sharpness" than malted wheat.

Ingredients.name: US Mild Ale Malt
Ingredients.description: Produces a wort with higher dextrin content than pale malts, resulting in a sweeter beer.

Ingredients.name: US Munich 10L Malt
Ingredients.description: Munich malt is a base malt that provides a malty, grainy flavor. Whilst it can self-convert, it has lower enzyme levels than pale or pilsner malts.

Ingredients.name: US Munich 20L Malt
Ingredients.description: Munich malt is a base malt that provides a malty, grainy flavor. Whilst it can self-convert, it has lower enzyme levels than pale or pilsner malts.

Ingredients.name: US Pale Ale Malt
Ingredients.description: Pale malt is the basic ingredient of many beers - especially ales. It is kilned at a low temperature over a long period and has good diastatic activity.

Ingredients.name: US Pilsen Malt
Ingredients.description: Pilsner Malt is kilned at fairly low temperature. It's flavor is usually described as slighty nutty and biscuity.

Ingredients.name: US Red Wheat Malt
Ingredients.description: Essential in making wheat beers, wheat is also often used in lower amounts in other beers as its protein gives the beer a fuller mouthfeel and enhanced beer head stability. Wheat malt contains considerably more protein than barley malt and consists primarily of glutens that can result in beer haze.

Ingredients.name: US Rice Hulls
Ingredients.description: Helps prevent the mash from settling and becoming stuck during the sparge.

Ingredients.name: US Roasted Barley
Ingredients.description: Used sparingly, this roasted grain imparts a sweet, coffee-like, grainy flavor and red to deep brown color. Typically used in Irish stouts.

Ingredients.name: US Rye Malt
Ingredients.description: Rye kilned to produce a typical smoked aroma. The malt is primarily used to create rye beers, smoked beers, Lagerbiers, and Kellerbiers

Ingredients.name: US Special Roast Malt
Ingredients.description: Lends a biscuity character and imparts a reddish hue.

Ingredients.name: US Victory Malt
Ingredients.description: Promotes a toasted biscuit-like flavor and aroma to your beer. Very similar ro Biscuit malt.

Ingredients.name: US Vienna Malt
Ingredients.description: Vienna is a rich, aromatic malt that will lend a deep color and full flavor to Vienna or Märzen style beers.

Ingredients.name: US White Wheat Malt
Ingredients.description: Essential in making wheat beers, wheat is also often used in lower amounts in other beers as its protein gives the beer a fuller mouthfeel and enhanced beer head stability. Wheat malt contains considerably more protein than barley malt and consists primarily of glutens that can result in beer haze.
